Cards are on the table. Start rolling in 3, 2, 1, GO! Who’s got fives? I need two ones! Four cards are drawn from the draw pile and everyone gets six dice of their own color. Fill the card targets with the dice, but you can’t do it alone. Each card must contain dice from two players. Work together to round up the dice needed and collect the points from the card. Will you form an alliance or turn against each other? Find out who’s your friend and who’s your frenemy in this fast paced game of dice.

-description from the publisher

Name: Blenheim to Balaclava: Rules for Warfare in the Age of the Musket
Description:
Blenheim to Balaclava

Rules for warfare in the age of the musket with 2mm armies.

Name: Horde
Description:
“All the clans are gathered. But confusion reigns in the ranks. Can you organize the horde so that it obeys you, and only you?“
Each clan is identified by the color of its favorite gem. Players lay out cards representing goblins to form battle lines, consisting of rows of twelve cards. Their objective is to align cards of their own color and have a majority of them in as many battle lines as possible, in order to obtain victory points. Each player depends on the hand he Is felt. Fortunately, even it's not their glow, each card in their hands has a unique power that can counter-balance fate and alter the game.
—description from the publisher

Name: Return to Dark Tower: Alliances
Description:
The Alliances expansion offers new rules and components to add further depth and variety to Return to Dark Tower. It includes two new heroes, who can be used in any game. The Archwright fortifies buildings to protect the kingdoms; the Haunted Recluse dabbles in forbidden lore to powerful effect. Influence is a new resource that can be used to form alliances with powerful guilds or to thwart the capricious whims of the nobles. It also features new treasures and allies with more intricate abilities for experienced gamers.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Pie Game
Description:
Welcome to the The Pie Game card game! Grandma needs your help, she signed up for the local bake sale to make one of her award-winning pies, but her bursitis is acting up and this is preventing her from making her pie. Can you help Grandma make the pie and save the day or will you disgrace Grandma by not getting your pie made?

For 2 to 8 players ages 6 and up. Game setup is simple as each player is dealt 1 of 8 unique recipe cards, such as: Apple Pie, Chocolate Cream Pie, Key Lime and others. Each recipe card lists the 5 ingredients that you need for your pie recipe. Next, each player is dealt 5 ingredient cards. The ingredients are all fresh and delicious with favorites like: Whipped Cream, Lime Juice, Chocolate Cookie Crust, Brown Sugar and Milk.

Game Play is just as easy, each player attempts to collect all recipe ingredients for their Pie as game play progresses through card draw and discard. Players draw new ingredient cards from the pile and discard unwanted ingredient cards from their hand to maintain 5 ingredient cards at all times. But watch out, because three could be trouble at every turn with Fudge and Double Fudge cards with the likes of: “Your neighbor wants to borrow some eggs” or “The cat knocked the sugar bowl off the counter”, these can cause you to discard, trade or pass your pie ingredient cards or even, lose a turn!

The first player to collect all 5 ingredients needed for their Pie recipe wins that round. Once someone completes their Pie, all recipe and ingredient cards are collected and redealt and the first person to win 3 rounds (or as many, or few rounds as everyone wants to play) wins the game… all other players have to disappoint Grandma and tell her they did not get their pie done (or maybe they just lose). So, don’t let Grandma down!

—description from the publisher

Name: Love Formula: Lucky in Love
Description:
Love keeps popping up in unexpected places, which is great news for a matchmaker like you! But sometimes the whims of chance can get in the way, so get ready to help your couples meet all of their relationship goals in this double-expansion!

The Lucky in Love Expansion includes the #RelationshipGoals and Take a Chance on Love mini-expansions for Love Formula. The #RelationshipGoals pack introduces a new game mechanic that allows players to earn extra points by completing #RelationshipGoals! Take a Chance on Love adds a random event each round!

Name: Love Formula: Kickstarter Promo
Description: Kickstarter exclusive cards for Love Formula. Adds new obstacle cards to the deck, including the Womanizer.

Name: 航海の時代 王家の書簡 (Kōkai no jidai ōke no shokan)
Description:
èˆªæµ·ã®æ™‚ä»£ çŽ‹å®¶ã®æ›¸ç°¡ (KÅkai no jidai Åke no shokan) (Era Of Voyage Royal Letter) is an expansion to the original Japanese edition of Discovery: The Era of Voyage.

The expansion allows a fifth player to play by including extra components. Two new home ports are added to the game, and eight new islands. These allow more variety in the game.

The expansion also adds Royal Letters and Contract cards.

A Royal Letter gives a unique end of game bonus. A Contract gives a bonus during the game but only to the first player to get it.

For example, a Royal Letter gives gives 3 points to the player with the most money at the end, and 1 point to the second most. Or, a player gets 1 point for each island they invested in by the end of the game.

A Contract for example might give 2 points for a payment of 9 pesos.

The player must return to their home port to select a Contract (instead of getting income for the port).
user summary

Name: 100 Astronauts
Description: "100 Astronauts" is a multiplayer colony building card game set in the deep reaches of space on planet T2853. In the game, you play a highly respected commander that has been sent on a mission to colonize planet T2853. Other highly ranked commanders will try to stop you as your goals & intentions on planet T2853 cross paths. Each game takes around 20-30 minutes and is guaranteed to leave you wanting to play more and more.

Name: 狩猟の時代~大河の恵み~ (Shuryo no Jidai~Taiga no Megumi~)
Description:
ç‹©çŒŸã®æ™‚ä»£~å¤§æ²³ã®æµã¿~ (Shuryo no Jidai~Taiga no Megumi~) is an expansion to ç‹©çŒŸã®æ™‚ä»£ (Shuryou no Jidai). The title means 'Era of Hunting - The Blessings of Taiga'. Taiga is boreal forest, a mix of pine, spruce and larch trees, typically with lakes and rivers.

This expansion introduces new elements to the game, and gives rules for a two player game. There are also additional pieces and boards to include in the base game.

Rivers and Fish - River cards tuck under the hunting grounds. As players collect resources, they can also get fish when they are shown in the corresponding spaces in the river. Fish can be used as food, or sacrificed on Altars.

Altars - there are ten double-sided cards which give 20 Altars. Players can sacrifice fish here and receive bonuses, either immediate or permanent.
user summary

Name: Civic Anarchy
Description:
The World is in Total Chaos!

2042, a cataclysm of manmade destruction and natural disasters has put the United States into a state of total anarchy. Players must take up their arms and compete to gain control over the cities of America in an attempt to unite them back under one rule.

Civic Anarchy is a 3X empire building game. Through levying troops, planting and harvesting crops, building structures, and taxing the populace, players gain strength to build armies to take new cities under their wing.
 Civic Anarchy uses a stream-lined chit-pull system. When a player’s chit is drawn, that player get actions equal to the number on the chit, but they may only choose one type of action. With several options available, the player must balance between current needs and future aggressions.

Players start with a small army. Through prosperous choices and conquering cities, they can build bigger armies with troop upgrades and strengthen their cities with resourceful buildings.

The player that reaches 10 Victory Points first is the winner.

Civic Anarchy comes with an integrated solo system to control Non-Player Characters with an AI deck, so that it may be played at any player count. The AI deck and flow chart order around the NPC’s, so the player/s may focus on controlling their own units.

—description from the publisher

Name: Feudal Wars: Revised 2nd Edition – Medieval Warfare Rules 1066 - 1404
Description:
Feudal Wars: Medieval Warfare Rules Revised 2nd Edition

The second edition covers the period 1289-1494

Rules for 25mm miniatures

Scale:
1 mini = 20 men
1" = 10 yards

Included army lists:


     French and Late Burgundian  
     French Early Italian Wars
     Easterlings (Brabant, Ghent, Liege, Flanders and Hanseatic League)
     Burgundians
     Imperialists
     Italian City States
     Spanish
     English - Late Hundred Years War
     French - Late Hundred Years War 
     English Wars of the Roses
     Scots


—description from the publisher
Families: History: Wars of the Guelphs and Ghibellines

Name: The Era of Traveling Merchant
Description:
The Era of Traveling Merchant, a.k.a. è¡Œå•†ã®æ™‚ä»£, is a pick-up-and-deliver game of merchants peddling their wares.

A peddler who travels through various cities and sells goods was indispensable to running the economy. Players go around each city to buy goods and fulfill their orders. Getting the goods sold by other players will help a player become the best peddler. Become one of the world's richest and prestigious merchants by successfully managing your products in multiple cities.

To set up the game, nine city tiles are arranged in one of the suggested ways, with each tile being divided into colored zones to match the player colors. Six order cards are dealt from a deck, which show various demands from these nine cities.

Players get two actions on a turn from a move action, a cargo action, or a shipping action. Players can move to cities; can pick up cargo from a city and place the goods in their wagon (but not goods they dropped previously); or ship goods to their storehouse in the city with the demand. By fulfilling demands, players collect order cards, gaining victory points. By taking the most prominent order cards, players receive jewel bonuses. By building up sets of order cards, players can increase the capacity of their wagons and build trading houses in cities; trading houses give the player a third action each round, which gives the player an advantage and is one of the endgame conditions.

The game ends either when the decks are exhausted, the special cards (difficult orders) are lost, or when a player has four trading houses.

All players get the same number of turns, then a final score is taken, most points wins. Points come from order cards, jewels, and from getting the last wagon card (marked fin).

Name: Airland War: Modern Armor Miniatures Rules
Description:
Airland War are wargame rules for modern armor, built on the framework established by Panzer War (needed).

Airland War is a set of game rules simulating modern warfare using 1/285 scale miniatures.

Since 1982, Airland Battle has comprised the US Army's basic doctrine concerning how to fight the next war.  It recognizes the inherently three dimensions of nature of modern warfare.  AirLand Battle conceives of a future battlefield nearly anywhere in the world on which the US Army must fight and win.

AirLand War includes rules covering weapons, troops, and vehicles used in most conflicts between 1948 and present.  Helicopter and ground support aircraft are thoroughly integrated into play.

Like Panzer War you have a realistic fire game system.  Even though 'fire combat' is considered a quantum of fire, you can still engage and destroy multiple targets in a single turn.

Sequence of Play

     TACTICAL ORDERS PHASE 
     COMMUNICATIONS PHASE 
     MOVEMENT PHASE  
         Aircraft/Helicopter /Infantry First Movement Segment.  
         AFV Close-up / Unbutton Segment  
         AFV Full Movement Segment  
         AFV  Half Movement Segment  
         AFV  Shift Movement Segment  
         Aircraft /Helicopter/Infantry Second Movement Segment 
    
     SIGHTING PHASE  (Primary) 
     COMBAT PHASE  
         Stationary Fire Segment  
         Shift Movement Fire / Old Artillery Segment  
         (Auto Sighting of First Firing Elements Seg.) 
         Half Movement Fire Segment  
         Full Movement Fire Segment  
         Close Assault / New Artillery Segment 
    
     SIGHTING FIRING ELEMENT PHASE (Final) 
     BATTLEFIELD MORALE PHASE 
     MISCELLANEOUS DETAILS PHASE


—description from the designer
